website_summaries.verdict: The smaller size makes this a great choice for a daily carry backpack.
pros: Designed with the student in mind
Specific pockets for pens, a key fob hook, and a dedicated space to hold and protect a tablet
cons: The smaller size keeps it from being an overnight bag

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but seams poorly sewn
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this backpack at the beginning of the school year. It appeared very durable. He used it for "A" Days and a different backpack for "B" Days so actually he used it every other day. It began to rip at the seams within the first 4-5 months! I didn't want to buy another so far into the year, so I attempted to sew the areas. Those areas held up afterwards, but holes continued to show up every few weeks! We finally gave up and bought another pack about 6-7 months into the school year.
customer_reviews.author: TMixon

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Backpack for People on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack after my last one broke, and it's wonderful. I don't own a car, so all of my grocery purchases and library trips are done by carrying everything in my backpack and then walking/taking public transportation. After reading some of the other reviews for this particular backpack, I was worried that the straps would quickly snap or that it wouldn't hold up well. I've had it for about six months now, and I needn't have worried about anything. It has held up wonderfully well, despite being shoved full of books almost constantly. It's comfortable to wear, with plenty of pockets of all sizes for organization.
customer_reviews.author: ReadYourselfHappy

customer_reviews.title: Comes with Blood
customer_reviews.text: Just received this backpack today and I like it. The quality looks good, love the compartments. It’s just want I needed but I’m super unhappy about the blood on it. That is something that shouldn’t make it pass quality control. I don’t have time to send it back as I need this bag for a trip so I’m scrubbing it with disinfectant and stain remover. There’s still a small amount of blood but I’m hoping it comes off after soaking. I’m not shy about blood but I don’t be want it on something I bought that’s brand new. Just gross.
customer_reviews.author: M & M

customer_reviews.title: A lot less space than I'd expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how they managed to make a backpack that can hold even less than the AmazonBasics backpack. If you're only carrying around flat items/small items with you, go for it. But if you're an extremely busy person that basically needs to carry EVERYTHING with you, I would advise against it. I tried transferring the contents from my previous backpack to this backpack and there wasn't enough room.
customer_reviews.author: Parsley Flower

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very durable backpack. I bought it for college, and it carries textbooks, a heavy laptop, and all kinds of art supplies. When it rained, it protected by stuff pretty well, but got the edges of my sketchbook wet, so it's not perfect, but almost. The only thing I dislike: On the end of the straps that come down from the bottom of the bag, there are these circular plastic bits. Whenever I'm sitting on a bench or a bus seat, they like to get caught between slats or whatever. It's a minor inconvenience, but otherwise this is a great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Spacious & Comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeds my expectations!! I just started nursing school and was using a business laptop carrying case, but needed something that offered more support since I had to carry all my heavy books up 3 flights of stairs. I was concerned that the backpack would hold all my books, but I went ahead and ordered it because I needed a backpack asap. I'm glad I did, because I received it in 2 days and it holds all my books, plus more. All of the extra pockets are amazing!! I just ordered my sister one for nursing school too. I would definitely recommend buying this backpack!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 10-year old approved!
customer_reviews.text: My 10year old niece loves this book bag! I got it in August for the new school year and she was excited to pack her bag right away. The color is like a cooler fuschia... maybe more purple than pink, and considered “cool” by her friends. I earned many auntie points with this and the matching stacked lunch bag;) Specifics that she asked for: -big enough to fit all the binders a fifth grader needs to carry plus an extra uniform -able to hold her water bottle -large shoulder straps for comfort -multiple zippers (no reason given) All were found on this bag. It also feels sturdy and like it’ll last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Cinny

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed with the quality - did not expect this when ...
customer_reviews.text: after 2 months of use the zipper broke off. very disappointed with the quality - did not expect this when buying High Sierra!
customer_reviews.author: thesmartbookclub.blogspot

customer_reviews.title: Good bag! nice color! does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Like most High Sierra backbacks its well made. If you buy it for your son or daughter going to school, it can certainly take all the ‘heavy load’ of books and stuff. I dont know why they make elementary school and middle schoolers carry so much stuff. this has a good padding for the back. Usually these kinds of bags, for a school goer, lasts for a year maximum. they take quiet heavy beating though - from rough use. Only complaint is that, depending upon how used, the side pockets tend to sog over time.
customer_reviews.author: Sath.N.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight and specious!
customer_reviews.text: Sturd, lightweight and specious! During this pandemic of the CORONA19 as a nurse I needed a bag where I could put an extra set of clothes to change my uniform prior to coming back home. With this extra pockets I was able to carry not only the extra set of clothes, but also goggles, stethoscopes, jacket, water, and hygiene products, all my essentials for a 12 to 16 hour shift. It is defenitly an awesome product. Very lightweight and sturdy. Multiple pockets. I would highly recommend it to anybody. My priority in a bag or purse it is its weight, this product definitely passed the test in all my expectations and demmands on a bookbag/bagpack. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We were super excited to find a bag that was cute, decent size, and reasonably priced. Unfortunately, I may be returning it if I can find something quickly. Pros: The colors and pattern are exactly as they appear. Very cute backpack. Pretty design. It is definitely functional with the various pockets. Cons: Quality is not what I expected for the price. Feels cheap (more specifically on the bottom). It does not feel like it can support the amount of books that my daughter brings back and forth to school. It sounds like a thick paper. The size in the picture also appears larger.
customer_reviews.author: Vb227

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart, even before use
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered on Friday (it was needed for a trip on Saturday). The seem was ripped before it was even used. Then after 2 days of use one of the zipper pulls fell off. Super poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for daughter to use for school. We were pleased at first but now the main zipper is not working. Zips but doesn’t zip closed. We still have 4 months of school and having to purchase a new backpack is frustrating. But, we can’t risk her laptop falling out or any notebooks. Not happy with having to spend more money. We went through 2 school years with one samsonite backpack and it was still going strong, should have purchased it again. Husband is using it in his job and it’s made it through an additional 1 1/2 years. Do not purchase this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: The Straps Break Easily, Customer Service Non-Existent
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is otherwise great, but the straps will break incredibly easy after mere days of light use. Customer service is a nightmare. They simply dodge you. I've politely contacted them 4-5 times in the past month looking for resolution to this issue and I've either gotten no response or "our warranty / customer relations team will reach out to you". Suffice to say, they never have. Still waiting, High Sierra. Still waiting...
customer_reviews.author: WG

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for work and I'm impressed. Many different compartments and sleeves. My Surface Pro fits in the laptop sleeve perfectly. Solid build quality; feels sturdy, like I paid twice the price. Not really a downside, but the tag on the backpack says there's a USB cable port. I don't see one anywhere. I won't hold anyone to it though, since it's not in the product description. High Sierra has served me well over the years... let's see how this backpack holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amin Ardehali

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite backpacks for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: Wr love this brand and are very loyal, we love most of their styles including this one. I have 4 kids, and found myself buying 2 to 3 backpacks a year from walmart and other store like them. Based on reviews and measurements we started buying these 6 years ago, they've never broken on a kid and I can wash them and reuse them for travel as well. I love these! They will not break! Now 3 kids are college and they still use these! I love the colors, they are great for high school and college kids I will be buying more as I always do as they become needed.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.S.

customer_reviews.title: So many compartments!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Loop backpack we have purchased for my elementary age son. (First one was stolen - ugh!) He is a little guy, and this backpack is pretty big, with plenty of room for all his things. The first backpack was used for the entirety of 4th grade, and was still in good enough shape to be used for 5th grade, but someone decided to take it for their own use. Without hesitation, he asked for the same exact backpack. He loves it, it's durable, and has plenty of pockets/zippers/compartments for all of the things boys need. 10/10, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget B

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality breaking twice
customer_reviews.text: I had my first backpack from Sierra about 4 years ago It was amazing for 2 plus years as I finally got my second one that the zipper broke on after 2 months.. Since I was so happy with my first one I got my third and this one is breaking at the seams in picture after 2 months really making me thi k the quality is not what it ones was Really sad on a former good brand
customer_reviews.author: Fredrik

customer_reviews.title: Many pockets. Separate laptop and keys pocket. Pens pocket.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the same backpack years ago when I started college for $38 and it lasted 4 years before a hole started to form above the zipper because I had a bad habit of grabbing the bag instead of the hand hold. I used it another year before the fray started getting in the zipper. Quickly got on Zappos where I got it the first time and it was discontinued so I came here and got a bigger selection. Will continue to use this until it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack! Durable and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement purchase for the same backpack. My son used this backpack for years carrying a big load of books and school supplies before it finally started to fall apart. He was NOT gentle on his backpack at all either. When it came time to replace it he asked for the same one because he liked it so much, even after carrying the same design for years. Definitely money well spent. I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Solid State Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack for the money. I’m a nurse that works on clinical research trials. I have to carry around subject paperwork, office supplies, and study supplies (like a holter monitor) from my office to hospitals to work sites. I wanted something with plenty of pockets to organize but also something that was cute. This arrived quickly, as pictured, and true to color. So far it has stood up to my abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa VanKirk

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is my second High Sierra backpack. I love this backpack because there's several compartments to put things in. I use it for traveling, as a carry-on bag, storing my camera, etc. I bought my first backpack of this type in 2013 (it lasted me 6 years). I did lots of travel and near the end I used it for 2 GoRuck lites which probably contributed to it's final end.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Lil Debbie

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than expected but wonderful otherwise
customer_reviews.text: This is not a full size but what I would consider about a 3/4 size backpack. It works for work, but would not recommend for school. It can not hold all that much. I must not have paid close attention to the dimensions when this was ordered. Otherwise very pleased with the construction and durability of HIgh Sierra backpacks. They last a long time. I have order several High Sierra backpacks over the decades. Always pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MarMar62

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried the water resistance aspect of the backpack because I have not gouged it in water yet, haha but I imagine it works just fine. The backpack is awesome. The colors are vibrant just like the photos, true to color. Big enough for an adult, because I was worried it would be smaller for a teen or child. Could definitely hold college books. Durability is great, you can tell it is not cheaply made. Overall I love the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jibs

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the only book bag that I have bought in the last four years for my son that has not broken! I bought it last school year for my then 7th grader. It has been through one full school year, a month of a new school year (he didn't want a new one yet), eight Boy Scout camping trips, one week of summer camp up in the mountains of GA and several sleepovers and it still looks good, and has not ripped or frayed. The straps are all in tact and the zippers are good. This was a great buy and an awesome bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Caprijax

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona. (BTW, Sedona is a must see.) Though jam packed, but within weight limits, it fit nicely in the overhead bins of the plane. Easy to take up and take off. Places for every thing for travel. In the summer, I've been using it to hold water bottles (very, very large ones) for my two dogs and a friend's two dogs, plus water for humans, when hiking in areas with no water. Very comfortable, even when heavy. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Prudence Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase this brand again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack in June for the purposes of work. And I really did like it but less than six months later it is already tearing at the seams. I had purchased another one a few years ago by the same brand and have not had any problems. I am not sure why this one is already tearing. I do not put a lot of heavy stuff in it or overload it.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a solid bag. I've had High Sierra personally back in college and professionally, so snagging one for my daughter for school was a no brainer. It's well made. After seeing a few reviews about seams and zippers, we checked the entire bag and found no defects. The seams are really hefty. The bag is so spacious and the straps are really comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Lakose

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it.
customer_reviews.text: My son who is in middle school loved it. "It is nice and kind of comfortable to carry around my text books"he said. When I asked him if he liked it. So I tired it myself and I have To say it was pretty comfortable, seemed almost effortless to walk around with 6 books a water bottle and an iPad. Side pockets for water was a must for him since they replaced recess with P.E. Lol. Thank you high Sierra for making my middle schooler happy which is hard to do this days. 3 months and still no no problems on wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am generally a suspicious person so I usually dont trust that the product i get will be as fabulous as the pictures make it seem. But I'm glad I took a chance on this bag. It's perfect for all of my textbooks, notebooks, lap top, and study guides. My biggest concern (because of the pictures) was that it would be really bulky, but the compression straps really slim it down. So it's really nice. Plus all of the zippers were nice and there were no loose threads or frayed fabric. Otherwise, it's got your basic backpack fabric. Stiff when you get but it softens over time with use. So yeah, overall, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this backpack for work. I work at a hospital shift work so I need to bring everything that I might need. I love all the zipper pockets. I can put keys and badge the small top pocket for easy access, toiletries in one, food/drinks in one and the side pocket for my compact umbrella. It rains a lot where I live and everything stays dry when I have that walk through the employee parking lot.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Covington

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who went into second grade. I love that it holds her things perfectly and isn’t a strain on her back no matter how heavy. The straps are adjustable and the material is very easy to clean. Only issue I’ve found are the strap ends hang down. There’s no way to tie them up or tuck them away. Other than that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Rawahneh

customer_reviews.title: This backpack wasn't what I was especting, and sadly, I have already returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The material was very thin and seemed to lack substance, body, and strength. Even the various straps seemed cheaply made and not sturdy, including the shoulder straps. Perhaps most troubling was the lack of breathability and comfort where the backpack contacts the wearers back - this is an area very important to a backpacker. The bag also lacked enough compartments to make it as useable as my last one, or the one I have already replaced it with. It seems they are trying to control costs and maximize profits, but it cannot be in the areas they seem to have focused on obtaining those savings. Close, but not cigar, as they say.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Fecteau

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great backpack if the zippers were better quality.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack looks like it high quality, and it is for the most part. I have now purchased two of these bags for my middle schoolers and both of them have had problems with the zipper splitting. I tried contacting he company and they were not very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality backpack. My freshman daughter wanted this for high school. I was a little surprised at the size. This backpack is much smaller for the price than the Lands End backpacks we usually buy and I'm worried she won't be able to fit much in it but I guess we will see in time. Otherwise a nice backpack. Just small.
customer_reviews.author: Julie K

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes this back pack and likes that it truly is water resistant. She did say the upper back of the back pack Is a little uncomfortable but not bad just not what she is used to. She has to carry all of her books and items for school and personal items on her at all times since their are no lockers at school so she feels this is still the most comfortable for all the weight she carries over the 7 hours a Day carrying it around
customer_reviews.author: denyse

customer_reviews.title: Room For EVERYTHING! (No wondering if your things will fit!)
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE these backpacks. My kids use them for school-one is in high school, one in elementary, I use mine for hiking, traveling, etc. When traveling it becomes my purse! There- are so many compartments that it's perfect for separating everything, and this backpack is surprisingly durable! From laptops & offices, to clothing and the wilderness- it's a great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: AmozonShopper

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bag I have bought! This one was a gift for a friend who loved mine and wanted to use hers for a baby travel bag! Love this bag I've had mine for over 2 years and still love it! Perfect for field trips with my students or long walks in the summer when I nanny!
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: We purchased the same one again for high school since she loved it so much
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing...Purchased this exact book bag for my daughter three years ago. She used it all three years of middle school. We purchased the same one again for high school since she loved it so much. Five months in and the book bag is falling apart. Seams are ripping apart at the handles and other spots. She takes very good care of her things so I don’t believe it’s her. She’s not carrying anything more in her bag then what she did in middle school. Very disappointed. We will for sure need to get another bag come next fall...
customer_reviews.author: JLS77

customer_reviews.title: Great medium sized pack
customer_reviews.text: I use this pack everyday. Just enough organization for my needs. Zippers open and close smoothly. Compression straps on the side are great and are placed right above the side pockets and helps to hold larger bottles . Also has two straps that go underneath great for carrying a bulky item. Shoulder straps are well padded. Does not have a dedicated laptop compartment, so if your packing around a laptop daily I would go with a different pack.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Very functional/great price
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is growing on me. At first I thought it was kind of ugly but I did choose the color so that's my fault but I do love that it has a lot of different compartments. If you are an organized person this backpack is perfect for you. I am somewhat disorganized so I find myself forgetting what I have in it. Over all I think this backpack is perfect for school or camping, really anything. Im satisfied with my purchase and I think it was one of the least expensive ones I found that had an extra area for laptop/tablet.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality backpack.
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 kids ranging in age from 2nd to 8th grade. So, every school year, we are typically buying several new backpacks. We've tried a wide range of styles and brands, and obviously some last more than others. These were a Deal of the Day on Amazon so I decided to get a couple of these for our kids. I have to say that I was very impressed. The quality of construction which is evident right away, and I love all of the innovative pockets and storage spots. There's a place for everything with these backpacks. I would highly recommend giving these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Robbiebeast

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for every - very well made
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids own these backpacks, stuff them completely full of books and schoolwork, and they've lasted for years. This is the only brand we will buy now. Plus, they have great little pockets for pencils, phones, keys, and items like that, as well as plenty of room for books and school folders. We just bought another one for my high schooler and it will last well into college. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie @ Back To My Southern Roots

customer_reviews.title: My go to backpack...faithful companion.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this six years ago but never wrote a review about it, until now. This has been my only travel backpack for abroad trips, camping, school, you name it. It’s still going strong. No tears, nothing! And this has taken quite a beat in planes, buses, cars, etc. Very roomy, very comfortable, and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: S.G

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: My sons favorite backpack, he has three of these in different colors for his active high school life. Very durable backpack! Perfect for working out, music folders and just plain going places. He always has one of these backpacks over his shoulder on the way out the door for an activity. Definitely a durable backpack!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Magnelli

customer_reviews.title: High Sierra backpacks are the best
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these High Sierra backpacks for my kids over the years. The last one was beat up by my son for four years before a zipper finally broke. These things are almost indestructible, even with daily abuse. When his old backback finally gave out, I ordered a new one just like it right away. These are just the best backpacks you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

customer_reviews.title: Warning tag
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for my ten yr old daughter she saw it and was so excited about it it came in 2 days was exactly what it said except I noted that there was a cancer warning tag on it we decided to return knowing this would be something she would be carrying for some time we did not want to take the risk not sure if a lot of backpacks have this warning but it is because of the material it's made out of I went back to look at the description and there was nothing listed about that but I am grateful for the warning label from the company
customer_reviews.author: DENISE WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Great Child Backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for both of my daughters. One is in 4th grade and the other in 6th. The backsacks are very roomy and lots of room for all their school supplies and them some. It even has a key holder in a zip pocket so I don't feel worried about my oldest carrying our house key to school. They seem sturdy and the straps are well cushioned. The designs are also adorable. I definitely recommend for an elementary school kid.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peacock

customer_reviews.title: great bags
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this brand for my twins when they started middle school- they carried them for years and still looks great. one wanted something different for high-school and she got the same brand because she said they are reliable and great looking and roomy for her laptop and books.. so yeah= great bag for the money- she said this will get me through high school..
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good sturdy backpack and arrived as described.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to use as his bookbag for school and it seems just right for that purpose. It would be to large for a smaller child but it's a good size for an eighth grader and it seems sturdy enough with lots of compartments. I'm not sure how weather proof it is, he hasn't taken it in the rain or snow yet but it looks like it'll pass the test.
customer_reviews.author: Emily K.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even last 2 months
customer_reviews.text: It’s not realistic as you see it , there was some opened spot when I received it , I didn’t have a time to return it but , I got very dissatisfied after 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Temesgen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this backpack for air travel for 5 years and I love it. It fits under my seat, has multiple sections and pockets with plenty of room. Fits my iPad, a book, snacks, clothing and I add my small shoulder purse before boarding so that it counts as one personal item instead of two. It has outside pockets and extra straps for my travel pillow. Stylish as well.
customer_reviews.author: MSM

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely cute and very roomy. I can't speak to the durability as it hasn't been used much since school isn't really happening. It's got a separate pocket with a sleeve for a small laptop or iPad/tablet. Plenty of room for books and supplies as well. The side pockets fit a large, slender water bottle. The small zipper pockets are on top are perfect size for writing utensils.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Lasted me 7 Years!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is especially durable as it lasted me for 7 entire years. Only recently has a zipper started acting up. The bag is extremely lightweight and is perfect for a kid to take to school or for an adult to use as a laptop bag. The straps are very good in that they absorb a lot of the tension in the shoulders that could cause back pain from carrying heavy items. Also, in the rain, nothing inside the bag is touched by water. Overall an amazing backpack!
customer_reviews.author: MiPo

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. I love the different compartments
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I got one in a different color for myself. I love the different compartments. Lots of Room. Very light weight. I only have a couple of issues the video shows that the backpack has a media pocket on the strap which would be very handy. The bag I received did not have that. I also don't usually use a backpack and I am not too sure what to do with the long hanging straps that are in the front bottom of the shoulder straps. This particular item was never received from the seller. Amazon did credit me my money. I love Amazon.com for backing up and taking care of their buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Denise MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Already Defective
customer_reviews.text: Fresh from the box I immediately noticed a loose thread at the top of the shoulder straps. Also the very small middle compartment isn't fully sewn in... making a very noticeable hole into the compartment behind it. Immediately, I'm extremely unimpressed and based on other reviews am wondering if my backpack is going to fall apart easily if it's really that cheap. Will add on to this later...
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: Great as a diaper bag
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this as a diaper bag because mine is too small. I bought one of the largest “diaper bags” on amazon and it wasn’t at all big enough. I emptied my diaper bag into the High Sierra and I still have barely even touched the biggest pocket! It has plenty of pockets for organizing if you need a good diaper bag. I can’t speak to the durability yet since I just got it but the fabric is sturdier than I expected and it feels great on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Katiekylevance

customer_reviews.title: A good day-pack, but uncomfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: Pack is well-made and sturdy, even had the sections and pockets I was looking for. The neon color is even not objectionable! But I had two problems with it. First, the shoulder straps are too long so that by the time it is cinched up properly there is about a foot of strap hanging down (and I'm tall!). And second, even though I like the yoke-style carry handle, the fabric comes far up on the back of my neck and is very stiff and rough. I think that I should look at women's styles.
customer_reviews.author: Texas gal

customer_reviews.title: Most useful bag for your dollar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack and fell in love with it, so I bought one for my sister as a gift and she loves it too. My Mom then got jealous and bought one for herself. It's really become a family affair. It's hard to explain how smart the design of this thing is because I'm still discovering it day-by-day. This backpack is down for whatever and does it well. It was my day-to-day bag in college with lots of pockets for separating books/computer/utensils. I've brought hiking and camping. I don't travel without it. It's my daily work bag. The straps are super comfortable which is important if you like to load a bag down like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Robinson

customer_reviews.title: WORTH BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I bought two High Sierra backpack for elementary school kids a long time ago. They love them, they use them all the time, and don't have any problems, still look very new. Now one of them is in high school, because many books are very heavy, the zipper is broken accidentally, after comparing many bags of the same price and quality, I still decided to buy a backpack of this brand to replace the broken one. I think it would be better if the zippers were reinforced, and I would buy them even if the price were raised.
customer_reviews.author: YQZ

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! My daughter spent her own money to purchase this backpack, which was advertised as a feathers on lavender design, for $36+(she paid extra for the special design and purchased a matching lunchbox from another seller)...the backpack we received was solid teal and not the quality expected. To add insult to injury, the seller left the price tag attached from another retailer for $19.99!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Love High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: My son is very particular about everything. Once we discovered High Sierra brand backpacks that is all he wants. We love the hook on the outside of the bag that easily allows attaching a lunchbox. His previous backpack lasted over two years of constant use . He is still using his original. we purchased this bag to have on hand as soon as school really picks up and his load gets heavier.
customer_reviews.author: LHamm99

customer_reviews.title: High Sierra is top-notch
customer_reviews.text: While I've only had this particular High Sierra backpack for about a month, I can definitely speak to the quality of this brand. Two of my children have had High Sierra backpacks that have lasted several years. When I say lasted, I mean all zippers still function perfectly and no rips or tears. My son had his original one for 6 years and only bought a new one after he wanted a different color. My daughter is going on 4 years and the backpack looks brand new. This is definitely a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mama V

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So I haven't used a backpack since 2003 and wasn't sure of which one to get. I noticed a few coworkers had the High Sierra brand so I decided to give it a try, so happy I did. We have to carry alot of heavy work related items and this bag has held up since July, its now January. I have to throw it around sometimes and it still looks good and hasn't ripped. I will definitely be purchasing another one in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: MsKing27

customer_reviews.title: Durable, long lasting, and spacious
customer_reviews.text: My dad bought this same backpack for my daughter in 3rd grade, she is now entering 8th grade and finally needed a new one, due to some minor wear and tear on the bottom of it. She’ll still use the olde one just not for school. The fit of the bag is awesome do there’s plenty of room for all her stuff. She’s pretty excited to have a new bag since it’s been a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Would not  have expected anything different!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compact,good look, reliable, durable and spacious. So I looked for what I know to be great quality. This Back pack is what the Dr. Order if I may say. High Sierra is known for its it's great products for years so really not much to say. Well lots lots of compartments with strong zippers and easy to adjust straps. You know is a back pack!
customer_reviews.author: Quiet

customer_reviews.title: lasted a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: This backpack lasted about a year and a half before the main zipper gave out. The fabric held up well, but if the main pocket doesn't close, the pack is finished. It's not as though the bag was stuffed with very heavy books--my kid is in early elementary school, before the homework stage. So just carrying lunch, maybe one small hardcover book, and winter clothes broke the bag in 18 months. Hoping for better durability from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: another newmama

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy loads, ripped seam...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this backpack in August 2015, for my high school student. He made it halfway through his 10th grade year, and it ripped on the seam. There is a limited lifetime warranty and a 1-800 number, I will try to call them for warranty service. If they honor the warranty, I will change the rating to 5 stars. It is the most comfortable backpack he has ever used, and he can carry a very heavy load with no back problems. The way the shoulder straps are designed really help with weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fournet

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Wife loves hers
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my wife who needed a travel backpack. She loves the color (teal/white) and all the pockets. Holds a good bit of items, although not too bulky. Perfect for travel and flights. I can't comment on the durability or longevity yet, but it seems to be well-made with really nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: NickJ

customer_reviews.title: Good backback
customer_reviews.text: This is my third backpack from High Sierra. They are good bags. This time I decided, instead of black and gray, to get the Wooly Weave. I expected it to be, well, wooly. It is not. It is just a nylon fabric with a "wool" pattern. Also, the backpack used to have a very convenient mesh pocket on the front strap. This one does not. For those two reasons I downgraded from 4 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rogalinski

customer_reviews.title: Big and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: I am primarily a bike rider and was in need of a replacement backpack. So it needed to be big enough to bring things home from the grocery store. And have room for the occasional odd item that is not big enough to carry but will fit in the bag just fine. And this one really fit the bill just nicely. There are pocket in this bag for almost anything you can imagine with room to spare. There is space for a laptop and 2 separate small pockets for keys and a phone. So this is also appropriate for school days also. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the backpack my son used for this school year. The size is good and it holds a lot. Problem is that the straps aren't comfortable. Not sure how to describe this, but look at the picture of the back of the backpack. At the top of the straps, they are connected together. My son says this is very uncomfortable, that it doesn't fit right across his back by his shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Alexander-walker

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the quality of this backpack.
customer_reviews.text: **Update** I have had this now for over 2 years and it is still in great shape! I use it for work, 5 days a week, and I fill it full at times. Definitely worth the money! Very well made and durable. This backpack isn't going to fall apart in a couple months. I use it for work, where I have to carry alot of heavy books and supplies around with me, just like a high school or collage student. It holds alot of stuff and is still comfortable to wear on my back.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this, great for college students
customer_reviews.text: I love his bookbag! I found the perfect one to replace my converse original bookbag. This is great for college students, there are so many compartments and plenty of space. I can fit my entire chemistry book (which is inside of a huge binder) in my bookbag!
customer_reviews.author: Sixela

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this backpack for about two or three years at this point. Not a seam has ripped on this thing. It fits a good amount of books too. Holds up with carrying heavy textbooks. I think I’ve even thrown this thing in the washer once before. The wide, connecting shoulder straps distribute the weight evenly along the shoulders. All in all, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Problem
customer_reviews.text: Everything else was great except the zippers. In less a year, the two zippers in the big pocket broke, and we can't fix it. My daughter loves the color, and the fabric is great, it's just the zippers. We are very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jie C.

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This was a last minute purchase for a short business trip. Very light weight and a good amount of pockets. The width and depth is larger than I expected, which worked out fine. I haven’t used all that much, but it appears it will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Watch2Wear

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack
customer_reviews.text: My middle school daughter uses this backpack. It's spacious and appears to be well made. If it's anything like her previous High Sierra backpack it will last into her high school years. It would also work well for a college student.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space + organization
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack to replace the need to bring 3 separate bags to work everyday: breast pump bag, purse, and lunch bag. I'm reviewing this bag having only used it one day because I love it. It's already made my life better. It easily fits everything I need in it, has enough pockets to allow for easy organization (mostly of stuff I'd keep in my purse but also for breast pump tubes and electrical cord), is light enough on its own to not weigh me down even more and even when it's fully packed with all my stuff, it feels very light on my back. The quality seems good so I'm hoping it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rnichols

customer_reviews.title: This is a great school backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for hiking, and it does the job, but I feel like it would be best suited for scholastic purposes. I gave it 5 stars on this premise. If you are thinking of buying this bag for school or around the town usage, DO IT!!! It's affordable and a good value for what you get. If, however, you are buying this product for hiking/survival/bugout, then let me go ahead and insist you look elsewhere. While this bag will get the job done, it just isn't made for that purpose. This bag wasn't meant for the wear and tear of the wilderness and doesn't come with the amenities that other bags more suited for the outdoors have.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Stormbringer

customer_reviews.title: High Sierra=High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Backpack was exactly as pictures. The colors were right on. It is Large, so not for a K-3, in my opinion. This was a gift for my rising 4th grade granddaughter, who chose this as her gift from me. She is petite, so at first we thought it was going to be too big, but she tightened the straps, loaded it up with books and have it a"thumbs up". Seems to be very sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Vic in NC

customer_reviews.title: Pockets for days
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty awesome, heavy duty, durable backpack with tons of storage and space. We've just gotten tired of the cheap backpacks that wear out or break after 3 weeks so, I am trying this one. The stitching is amazing and is triple stitched where you would grab it most.
customer_reviews.author: Got it here.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price,  great size,  amazing bag!!
customer_reviews.text: These bookbagss are amazing. For the last 5 years my kids have gone through 3 bags by christmas. These have held up great, and still look new. My kids are in 7th grade and a freshman in high school, so they carry tons of stuff, including stuff for activities on top of their normal stuff. So great size, great price, amazing bag!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Customer for life!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, comfortable fitting back pack. I use it for work. I havent tested it but I would believe that the water resistant feature is effective. Very well made product. I'm a larger person and the straps lengthen enough that I don't feel lile Chris Farley trying to squeeze in a coat. The color is gorgeous. Im definitely sold on this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a picky 8th grader
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter's upcoming school year. She is in love with it! It has adequate pockets and compartments in varying sizes for all her needs. She has the big binder that has all the added extras like a pencil pouch added and I was worried about that fitting easily but it fits nicely. She likes that it has a decent sized media pocket for her phone
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Boone

customer_reviews.title: Large, well made
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 yr old. It is huge, makes me think of a high school backpack. However it will be great in the winter for her snow boots and snow pants. Also the stitching looks high quality and seems like it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backpack for some basic traveling to carry camera equipment and a few random items...this backpack is fantastic for that! It's very roomy, lots of pockets, lightweight, and the straps are comfortable! It also holds a laptop and/or tablet in a separate compartment the color is also very bright and vibrant!
customer_reviews.author: Jennilyn

customer_reviews.title: durable and roomy backpack, especially for price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this backpack for a year now (freshman year of college), and it has lasted very well. The cushioning at the shoulders makes it comfortable to wear, even all day (though there is still no avoiding back sweat on hot days). Its straps help it work either as a big backpack or a light backpack, as the situation demands -- if I loosen the straps, it has enough room that I've used it as my only bag for 4- and 5-day trips. I've taken it as a personal item on several flights and never had any trouble. It has lots of compartments, which can help with organization. However, it is not very waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo Grigni

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack to use as a personal item for airline travel and it worked great! The back is very rugged and his made of high quality materials. It has two smaller zipper pockets on the outside that work great for the items you need to get to quickly like headphone and charging cables. It fit under the seat during a recent United Airline flight in economy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Straps tore after a few months
customer_reviews.text: this backpack almost made it through the school year, but in march the straps started to come undone from the bag. I did have 2 heavy honors textbooks in it daily along with a binder, a big spiral, and a laptop, so maybe with a lighter load it would hold up better
customer_reviews.author: Kendal Vandenhoek

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag. Ultra Lightweight. Compact. It doesn't feel as if you even have a backpack on your back. It doesn't feel as study as the other High Sierra lineups, but you wouldn't be purchasing this specific model if you are looking to go hiking or lugging around alot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and holding up well
customer_reviews.text: When you second grader needs a new backpack this will work. It is large on her but the quality has been great and she will probably get a few years of use from this before moving on to the next backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid People are Annoying

customer_reviews.title: Last longer than others for school loads
customer_reviews.text: One of my backpacks has been used for 2 school years and started the 3rd last month with no issues. The other only lasted one school year and a month into the next when the zipper started to separate. Both backpacks are filled daily with very heavy books so if your load is lighter it should last much longer. I always choose this brand because others don't seem to make it very long into the school year.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack. Padded straps are a must for high school and heavy books. Wish the inside was a bit more padded. Seems a bit thin and not as hearty as ones I've bought before. Still a nice one though.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This came simply packaged and my daughter loves it. She got the matching lunch bag with it for school. Seems very durable and holds all of her school supplies. Unsure about the water resistance at this time, as it hasn’t gotten wet, but I imagine it will hold up like lost backpacks. Definitely a good price when on sale as well!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack for motorcyclists
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this backpack for half a year going to and from school on a motorcycle. It has held up very well. I haven't noticed any tearing or ripped straps so that's a plus. The zippers never give me any trouble, which I really appreciate. The style of it is very sleek and clean, and I think it looks cool. It is not a huge puffy backpack. I can fit 2 or 3 textbooks (depending on size) in the biggest pocket and 5 or 6 notebooks in the second pocket. It's not the largest backpack, but if you're looking just to carry a few books and notebooks to class, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: You’ll need it for middle school.
customer_reviews.text: Size for my 11 year old girl, who is shorter than most of her friends, is perfect. I was afraid that it was going to look too big on her, but it looks great. And! She can fit everything she needs and then some. Six graders need bigger back packs than 5th graders for sure.
customer_reviews.author: PabloTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack daily for work and love all it's little compartments, I did have to buy a separate laptop sleeve because there's not enough cushion at the bottom of the bag. Besides that it's perfect. I also used it for a short trip and was surprised how much I could actually fit in there.
customer_reviews.author: Ameteal

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my old Sierra
customer_reviews.text: I got this with the hope that it would be like my old High Sierra but it's sadly not. It's not that bad but I'm not a fan of the pocket layout or the terrible le texture of the fabric. My old one has the stiff fabric in only a few spots. Whereas this one is made entirely out if that fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Good overall for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall really good pack. My teen uses this daily and it seems really sturdy & roomy. She carries boatloads of stuff everyday so I was pleased to see some back support that is still simple structurally. The blue is really pretty...like a periwinkle but brighter and a little darker. My pic makes it look duller than it is. Good water pockets too.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

product_meta.title: High Sierra Loop Backpack
product_meta.description: The versatile High Sierra Loop backpack is at home on and off the trail. The multi-compartment design keeps your gear organized. The side compression straps are adjustable to secure your items down and the adjustable bottom webbing straps are perfect for carrying items like a sleeping bag or tent. For days in the office, the Loop has storage for your tablet, phone and other personal digital gear. The multi-pocket organizer with key fob hook provides storage for all of your smaller items. Whether you are hiking a new trail or heading to class, the High Sierra Loop is the perfect travel companion.
feature_bullets: Dedicated TECH SPOT tablet computer sleeve (12.5 x 11 x 0.75 in.)
Attach extra gear with monster hook and bottom straps
